settings.heading: Features
settings.content:
The IronHorse Lunar Series: A New Dawn for Freestyle Biking in the 2000s

While there are countless bikes that have left their mark on the cycling world, some stand apart for their distinctive design, superior performance, and notable impact on their respective cycling genres. One such bike series is the IronHorse Lunar, which brought a new dawn to freestyle biking in the 2000s.

IronHorse Bikes: An Introduction

IronHorse Bikes is known for producing high-performance bikes, primarily targeting the mountain biking and freestyle markets. The company, in its glory years, introduced several bikes, with each new model carrying a legacy of innovation and performance. The Lunar series is undoubtedly one of IronHorse’s crowning achievements.

IronHorse Lunar Series: A Paradigm Shift

Unveiled in the early 2000s, the Lunar series from IronHorse redefined the freestyle biking landscape. It brought together an amalgamation of advanced technology, robust build quality, and an aesthetic design that appealed to the enthusiasts of the era.

Built with high-tensile steel frames and sporting a sleek design, the Lunar series was both robust and pleasing to the eye. The bikes were available in a variety of vibrant colors and featured a mix of sharp and curved lines, reflecting the aggressive yet fluid nature of freestyle biking.

Breaking Barriers with Performance

Where the Lunar series truly shone was in its performance. These bikes were not just built for casual rides; they were made to conquer challenging terrains and enable riders to pull off daring tricks with ease.

The Lunar models were equipped with durable, double-wall alloy rims, offering increased stability during high-impact landings. Furthermore, the combination of a sturdy crankset and a robust chain ensured maximum power transfer, making these bikes ideal for performing a range of freestyle tricks.

One significant addition to the Lunar series was the rotor system, which allowed 360-degree handlebar rotation without tangling the brake cables - a necessity for freestyle riders who often perform tricks that require full handlebar spins.

The Lunar Legacy

Although IronHorse faced economic difficulties in the late 2000s, the legacy of the Lunar series lives on. These bikes are still revered by many, and it's not uncommon to spot a well-maintained Lunar at freestyle events or being used by urban bikers who appreciate the robust build and dynamic handling of these bikes.

Today, the Lunar series is more than just a line of bikes. It's a symbol of a time when freestyle biking was experiencing significant transformations, and a reflection of a brand that wasn't afraid to innovate and push the limits of what was possible in bike design and performance.

In retrospect, the IronHorse Lunar series represents a fascinating chapter in the history of freestyle biking. Its influence extends beyond its time, inspiring modern bikes and reminding us of a transformative era in biking. Even as technology advances and the biking landscape changes, the Lunar series remains a beloved relic, a testament to the spirit of innovation and

settings.heading: Description
settings.row_content:
Hardcore clothing Premium eco hoodie

This ain't just any hoodie; it's a premium eco hoodie made of 85% organic cotton and 15% recycled polyester. You heard that right, it's eco-friendly but still hardcore as hell. The ribbing is 97% organic cotton and 3% elastane, giving you that snug, comfortable fit.
